title: California Senator Dianne Feinstein won't run for reelection
description: The announcement came after several prominent Democrats, including US Reps. Katie Porter and Adam Schiff, already had declared Senate campaigns.

title: Fans receive UEFA's report on Stade de France violence with both satisfaction and anger
description: The representatives of football fans have applauded the findings of the Union of European Football Associations' independent panel investigating the causes of the security and ticketing fiasco during the Champions League final in Saint-Denis on May 28.

title: New York's budding cannabis industry prioritizes ex-offenders
description: Nearly two years after legalizing recreational marijuana, New York state is for the moment only allowing those with a criminal record related to the drug to sell it.

title: Pharrell Williams takes over menswear at Louis Vuitton
description: The hip-hop artist is filling a spot left vacant since the death of designer Virgil Abloh in November 2021.

title: Rising toll makes quake worst in Turkey's modern history
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan announced that 35,418 have died in the country as a result of last week’s earthquake.

title: Energy transition: 'BP was the best student in the oil industry'
description: The British oil giant said last week it was to slow down an exit from fossil fuels before backtracking. The issue affects all players in the sector, writes Philippe Escande in his column.

title: PSG-Bayern Munich: Two models of ego management
description: Parisians and Bavarians meet again on Tuesday for the Champions League round of 16, in a Valentine's Day duel that represents a 'clash of cultures'.

title: #StoryKillers: The disinformation campaigns that threaten the lives of journalists
description: Like too many in her profession, Indian journalist Gauri Lankesh was murdered in 2017 after she was the target of a campaign of lies. 'Le Monde' and the Forbidden Stories consortium investigated this booming fake news industry.

title: Police seek motive of gunman who killed 3 at Michigan State
description: The 45-year-old with a previous gun violation fatally shot himself after an hourslong manhunt

title: Italian PM Meloni passes electoral test in regional races
description: Her party won elections in the country's two most populous regions, Lombardy and Lazio, where it outperformed even its allies in the national right-wing coalition.

title: Trugoy, rapper in the mythical group De La Soul, has died
description: One of the three voices of the American rap group De La Soul, Trugoy, whose real name was David Jolicoeur, died on February 12 at the age of 54.

title: Banksy unveils Valentine's Day artwork taking aim at domestic violence
description: The British graffiti artist unveiled a new mural in Margate, in southeast England.

title: Deep-sea mining noise pollution threatens whales
description: A new study found that seabed mining could harm ocean ecosystems, particularly blue whales and other cetaceans.

title: Police find more body parts in popular Paris Buttes-Chaumont park
description: A homicide investigation was launched after part of a woman's body was discovered in the northern Paris park on Monday.

title: After 10 years, 19,000 refugees officially allowed to settle in Australia
description: In 2013, Canberra instituted a particularly harsh migration policy that stops boat people from establishing themselves in the country.

title: China's Xi hails Iran 'solidarity'
description: The Chinese President is hosting his Iranian couterpart for a three-day visit

title: Nikki Haley to run for US presidency, challenging Trump
description: The former South Carolina governor said a need for "generational change" was behind her decision to challenge her former boss.

title: EU parliament votes to ban petrol car sales by 2035
description: Member states have already approved the legislation and will now formally nod it into law.

title: Ford to slash 3,800 jobs in Europe, mostly Germany, UK
description: The United States car maker said competition in the electric car sector was behind the decision.

title: WHO calls Turkey's earthquake Europe's worst natural disaster in a century
description: The health agency of the United Nations said it was still studying implications of the earthquake which struck Turkey and Syria on February 6.

title: Hans Modrow, last communist head of East Germany, has died
description: His short time at the head of a dying GDR after the fall of the Berlin Wall was marked by an unprecedented political opening. He died on February 11, at the age of 95.

title: Airbus, Boeing seal mega deal with Air India amid global traffic rebound
description: The Indian airline on Tuesday purchased 250 aircraft from the European manufacturer and 220 from Boeing of the United States.

title: Israel's Netanyahu speeds up justice reform despite wide protests
description: Tens of thousands of people demonstrated on Monday in Jerusalem against the government's plan to limit the powers of the Supreme Court. The first bills will be debated on Wednesday in the Knesset.

title: Violence at the Stade de France: UEFA harshly criticized by independent investigation
description: The independent panel concluded that the Union of European Football Associations 'bears primary responsibility for the failures that almost led to disaster' at the Champions League final in Saint-Denis, on May 28, 2022.

title: BBC offices in India raided by tax officials after Modi documentary
description: The searches come weeks after release of BBC documentary critical of the Prime Minister that was later blocked by government.

title: Twitter threat to charge for crucial tool provokes outcry
description: This plan to charge for use of specific tools could particularly affect volunteers working in natural disasters, including the earthquakes in Turkey and Syria.

title: Champions League final fiasco: Damning UEFA report points to French police's failures
description: In a report read by 'Le Monde', UEFA's independent panel criticizes the security management of the Champions League final between Liverpool and Real Madrid, in Saint-Denis, May 28, 2022.

title: Bill Clinton returns to the White House. Does anyone care?
description: Bill Clinton visited the White House to celebrate the 30th anniversary of the creation of maternity leave. It was an opportunity to see the former and current presidents of the United States almost side by side.

title: Bus and armored truck crash in South Africa kills 20
description: Downpours have caused flooding in several regions of the country in recent days.

title: United States: Three people dead in shooting at Michigan State University
description: In addition to the deaths, five people have been injured as the search for the shooter continues.

title: The resurrection of Sweden's nuclear program
description: After winning the legislative elections on September 11, 2022, the Swedish right and far-right want to stimulate the construction of new reactors. Almost 30% of the electricity produced in Sweden currently comes from its six active reactors.

title: Basel's Fondation Beyeler explores how Wayne Thiebaud goes beyond pop art
description: The exhibition does justice to the palette and mastery of the American artist, who has gone largely unnoticed in Europe.

title: Turkish Cypriots mourn the loss of children killed in earthquake
description: The death of 39 people in a hotel that collapsed during the earthquake reveals negligence, corruption and a disregard for antiseismic standards by the Turkish construction sector.

title: New Zealand declares state of emergency as Cyclone Gabrielle devastates
description: In what officials called an 'unprecedented weather event', New Zealand have declared a state of emergency for only the third time in its history.

title: Germany: The AfD, a far-right party born 10 years ago, now aspires to govern
description: Founded in 2013 to campaign for exiting the eurozone, the Alternative for Germany party has transformed over the years into a radical far-right party firmly entrenched in the German political landscape.

title: 'In 2022, Europe's growth was stronger than that of the United States and China'
description: In an interview with 'Le Monde,' European Commissioner for the Economy, Paolo Gentiloni, says that the Europe should narrowly escape a recession.

title: Man driving U-Haul truck hits pedestrians in New York
description: The mayhem unfolded over a harrowing hour as the truck tore through Brooklyn's bustling Bay Ridge neighborhood injuring eight people, two critically.

title: Italy: Giorgia Meloni's right-wing coalition wins regional elections
description: Amidst low turnout, the governing coalition emerged victorious from the vote, strengthening the prime minister's position just months after taking office.

title: More than a third of fish caught in France come from overfished species
description: At its annual conference, the French National Institute for Ocean Science, IFREMER addressed the impact of different types of fishing equipment on marine ecosystems.
